definition: to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: HTML to shangguan persuading people after two.
sentences.chinese: 待上官于飞劝服两人之后。

sentences.english: Sceptical customers and counterparties would still need to be convinced to deal with the new company.
sentences.chinese: 怀疑的顾客和合约方仍需要被劝服来和新公司打交道。

sentences.english: Concise and kam fortis phones, jin fu guarantee will persuade grams frequently do not tell son.
sentences.chinese: 简洁与锦富通电话，锦富保证会劝服克勤不告允儿。

sentences.english: The Fus were becoming increasingly persuaded that Wang Xiaomei was a pretty good bet.
sentences.chinese: 付家正在逐渐被劝服，认为王小梅是个很好的人选。

sentences.english: If you can't persuade them for the right reasons, then scare them with the facts.
sentences.chinese: 如果用恰当的理由不能劝服他们，那么告诉他们事实。

sentences.english: I can be enticed step by step.
sentences.chinese: 我能够被人一步一步地劝服。

sentences.english: I could reason myself into sufficient courage to sit up and look out into the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我能劝服自己拥有足够的勇气坐起来，望向远方。

sentences.english: We have succeeded in persuading many districts to desegregate voluntarily .
sentences.chinese: 我们已圆满地劝服了许多地方自愿取消种族隔离。

definition: to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
to get sb to understand/to persuade
